Abstract: The integration of machine learning (ML), graphical processing units (GPUs), and cloud computing has revolutionized the field of interactive quantum chemistry, offering unprecedented computational power and accessibility. This study explores the development of natural user interfaces (NUIs) that leverage chemical structure recognition to facilitate intuitive interactions with complex quantum chemical simulations. By harnessing the parallel processing capabilities of GPUs and the scalable resources of cloud computing, researchers can now perform high-accuracy quantum chemical calculations in real-time. Furthermore, the incorporation of extended reality (XR) technologies enhances the visualization and manipulation of molecular structures, providing a more immersive and interactive experience. This paper highlights the synergistic potential of these technologies in advancing quantum chemistry research, making sophisticated computational tools more accessible to a broader scientific community and paving the way for innovative discoveries in molecular science.
